Description: A planned process with the objective to produce information about the material entity that is the evaluant, by physically examining it or its proxies.
A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment.
A biological entity.
A type of Information Content Entity specific to OS.
A module for next generation sequencing assays.
A type of submitted metadata.
A component for an individual's biomedical demographic attributes.
DependsOn: Patient ID, Year of Birth, Vital Status, Treatment Type, Treatment Outcome, Treatment Intent, Component

Description: A component for a single-cell RNA-seq assay.
DependsOn: Filename, File Format, Sample ID, Nucleic Acid Source, Single Cell Isolation Method, Library Preparation Date, Library Construction Method, Sequencing Platform, Total Number of Input Cells, Component

Description: The pseudonymized identifier associated with a patient.
The physical sex assigned at birth.
The year during which the patient was born (format: YYYY).
The survival state of the patient.
When the vital status when the patient has died.
DependsOn: Cause of Death, Year of Death

Description: The cause of death for the patient.
Valid Values: Cancer Related, Not Cancer Related, Unknown, Not Reported

Description: The year during which the patient died (format: YYYY).
The modality of the treatment administered to the patient.
Valid Values: Chemotherapy, Radiotherapy, Surgery, Other, Unknown, Not Reported

Description: The patient's final outcome after the treatment was administered.
Valid Values: Complete Response, Partial Response, No Response, Unknown, Not Reported

Description: The name of the associated data file.
The format of the file contents.
The pseudonymized identifier associated with a patient's biosample.
The source of the input nucleic molecule
Valid Values: Single Cell, Bulk Cell, Single Nucleus, Bulk Nuclei

Description: When the nucleic acid source is single cells.
DependsOn: Single Cell Isolation Method, Total Number of Input Cells

Description: When the nucleic acid source is single nuclei.
DependsOn: Single Cell Isolation Method, Total Number of Input Cells

Description: The method by which cells are isolated into individual reaction containers at a single cell resolution.
The number of days since sample received in lab (proxy for the date that the libraries were prepared for sequencing).
The process which results in the creation of a library from fragments of DNA using cloning vectors or oligonucleotides with the role of adapters.
The set of instruments used to perform the sequencing.
Valid Values: Illumina Next Seq 500, Illumina Next Seq 2500, Illumina NovaSeq 6000

Description: The number of cells loaded/placed on plates
